acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 26.4mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (dermal route) of 26.4mg/kg (RTECS (2006)), 31mg/kg (HSDB (2006)) and 108mg/kg (HSDB (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation of dust/mist) value of 0.05mg/L (4 hours) (HSDB (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 9.66mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 10mg/kg (RTECS (2006)) and 9.66mg/kg (HSDB (2006)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: The substance acts on iron and steel according to ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3018 Organophosphorous Pesticide, liquid, toxic (ICSC, 2004) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data (no data available on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests)

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3018 Organophosphorous Pesticide, liquid, toxic (ICSC, 2004) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Although classified as flammable, the substance does not catch fire easily (HSDB, 2006). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3018 Organophosphorous Pesticide, liquid, toxic (ICSC, 2004) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3018 Organophosphorous Pesticide, liquid, toxic (ICSC, 2004) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (adrenal gland)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "changes in the adrenal cortex of males, which included increased incidence and intensity of ceroid pigment and focal hypertrophy and increased severity of nodular hyperplasia" (JMPR 877 (1994)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (J) (1998): "The substance adversely affects the nervous system; can induce spasm and respiratory failure. As a cholinesterase inhibitor, it may cause loss of consciousness, and in some instances, death. These effects may be delayed." Since the priority rating of the referenced study is 2, the substance is classified into Category 2 (nervous system).
